file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 57-10-01-04 - WING-TO-STUB ATTACHMENT BOLTS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WING-TO-STUB ATTACHMENT BOLTS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the Wing-To-Stub Attachment Bolts. B. The procedures to removal and installation must be applied one bolt at a time in each half-wing. NOTE: • The next bolt in each half-wing only must be removed if the previous bolt is installed. • The removal and installation could be done in any sequence, since that the bolt removed in the (LH) and the (RH) half-wing stub be in the same position. • It is not necessary to wait for sealant cure time and final torque in order to start with the next bolt removal. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY WING-TO-STUB ATTACHMENT BOLTS - ALL 57-10-01-000-801-A REMOVAL WING-TO-STUB ATTACHMENT BOLTS - ALL 57-10-01-400-801-A INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 57-10-01 Page 1 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 57-10-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. WING-TO-STUB ATTACHMENT BOLTS - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the Wing-To-Stub Attachment Bolts. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-44-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM MPP 07-20-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE DEFUELING - SERVICING AMM TASK 20-40-02-910-801-A/200 STATIC GROUNDING - STANDARD PRACTICES FORWARD WING-TO-FUSELAGE FAIRING - REMOV- AMM TASK 53-04-01-000-801-A/400 AL AMM TASK 53-04-10-000-801-A/400 CENTER WING-TO-FUSELAGE FAIRING - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 155 155BZ/155NZ Wing Stub, LH wing 156 156BZ/156NZ Wing Stub, RH wing 531 531AB/531EZ LH wing 631 631AB/631EZ RH wing D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Wrench, ratchet, 1/2 in drive To remove the bolts available Commercially Wrench, socket, long, 15/16 in, 7/8 in, To remove the bolts available 3/4 in, 11/16 in, 5/8 in drives Commercially Wrench, socket, short, 11/16 in, 5/8 in To remove the bolts available drives Commercially Wrench, spline, small, 11/16 in, 15/16 To remove the bolts available in, 3/4 in, 5/8 in drives Commercially Wrench, spline, small, 11/16 in x 15/16 To remove the bolts available in drive Commercially Ratchet Adaptor, big and small 1/2 in To remove the bolts available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 57-10-01 Page 2 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Do the task Wing-to-stub attachment area I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Do the aircraft shoring ( AMM MPP 07-20-00/200). (3) Statically ground the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-02-910-801-A/200). (4) Defuel the tanks ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300). (5) Remove the forward wing-to-fuselage fairing ( AMM TASK 53-04-01-000-801-A/400). (6) Remove the center wing-to-fuselage fairing ( AMM TASK 53-04-10-000-801-A/400). WARNING: DO NOT WORK IN THE TANK BEFORE A COMPLETE VENTILATION IS APPLIED TO ITS INTERIOR ( AMM MPP 28-00-00/200). WEAR PROTECTIVE MASK AND GOGGLES TO WORK IN THE FUEL TANK. CAUTION:FUEL MAY SPILL DURING REMOVAL OF THE LOWER SKIN ACCESS PANELS. (7) Remove access panels 155BZ/156BZ, and 155NZ/156NZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (8) Remove access panels 531AB/631AB, and 531EZ/631EZ ( AMM MPP 06-44-00/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove one bolt at a time in each half-wing. NOTE: The removal could be done in any sequence in each half-wing, since that the bolt removed in the (LH) and the (RH) half-wing stub be in the same position. (2) Remove the old sealant from the assembly (its bolt, washers, rings, and nut). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 57-10-01 Page 3 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 57-10-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. WING-TO-STUB ATTACHMENT BOLTS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the Wing-To-Stub Attachment Bolts. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-44-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE REFUELING - SERVICING AMM TASK 20-40-02-910-801-A/200 STATIC GROUNDING - STANDARD PRACTICES FWD WING-TO-FUSELAGE FAIRING - INSTALLA- AMM TASK 53-04-01-400-801-A/400 TION CENTER WING-TO-FUSELAGE FAIRING - INSTALLA- AMM TASK 53-04-10-400-801-A/400 TION SRM 51-20-01 - TASK 28–11–00–300–801–A - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 155 155BZ/155NZ Wing Stub, LH wing 156 156BZ/156NZ Wing Stub, RH wing 531 531AB/531EZ LH wing 631 631AB/631EZ RH wing D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque Wrench, 0-300 lbf x in To measure the drag torque available Commercially Torque Wrench, 300-2500 lbf x in (fixed To torque the bolts that attach the wing to available head) the stub Commercially Torque Wrench, 500-2500 lbf x in To torque the bolts that attach the wing to available (ratchet) the stub GSE 148 Adapter - Torque, Wing/Fuselage Bolt To apply torque to the A42 and A43 bolts To apply torque to the A27, A35, A41, A29, GSE 383 Spline Torque Adapter A39, A31, A37, and A33 bolts Commercially To apply torque with GSE 383 or commer- Adapter, hex to square, 9/16 in x 1/2 in available cially available tool accordantly Commercially Wrench, ratchet, 1/2 in drive To install the bolts available EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 57-10-01 Page 6 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (Continued) ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Wrench, socket, long, 15/16 in, 7/8 in, To install the bolts and to measure the drag available 3/4 in, 11/16 in, 5/8 in drives torque Commercially Wrench, socket, short, 11/16 in, 5/8 in To install the bolts available drives Commercially Wrench, spline, small, 11/16 in, 15/16 To install the bolts available in, 3/4 in, 5/8 in drives Commercially Wrench, spline, small, 11/16 in x 15/16 To install the bolts available in drive Commercially Ratchet Adaptor, big and small, 1/2 in To install the bolts available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-PRF-81733 Type IV-12 Sealant, P/S 870 - C12 AR NE 07-022 F925 - Yellow - Inspection Torque Paint AR Antibiological compound (Integral fuel tank coating), base AMS-C-27725 TYPE II - 825/309, activator - 910/702, and reducer - 020/707 (DE AR SOTO) or other approved compound G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 2 Do the task Wing-to-stub attachment area I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A CAUTION: DO NOT USE NUTS AGAIN THAT HAVE SIGNS OF DAMAGE TO THE SELF- LOCKING ELEMENT OR THE DRAG TORQUE VALUE IS OUT OF THE SPECIFIED VALUE. (1) Measure and record the drag torque of the assembly. It must obey the values given in Table 401: Table 401 - DRAG TORQUE OF THE NUTS Drag Torque (lbf x in) Bolt Thread minimum maximum 1/2 in - 20 UNJF-3A 18 150 9/16 in - 20 UNJF-3A 24 200 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 57-10-01 Page 7 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL Table 401 - DRAG TORQUE OF THE NUTS (Continued) 5/8 in - 20 UNJF-3A 32 300 3/4 in - 20 UNJF-3A 50 400 NOTE: If the value of drag torque found is out of specified value, the nut must be replaced. (2) Apply a fillet of sealant P/S 870 - C12 around all washers of the bolts and nuts (SRM 51-20-01) as shown in Figure 402. J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the bolt, washers, and nut. NOTE: Install the assembly in the same position as it was when it was removed. (2) Refer to Table 402 and apply tightening torque to the nut or bolt: NOTE: • The tightening torque values are different for the nuts to which the torque is applied with the aid of adapters. For these bolts, the Table 403 must be used. • Do not remove the excess sealant from the edges of the washers. (3) Refer to Table 402 and apply final tightening torque to the nut or bolt from 6 to 12 hours after the sealant was applied. NOTE: • It is not necessary to wait for sealant cure time and final torque in order to start with the next bolt removal. • The final tightening torque values are different for the nuts to which the torque is applied with the aid of adapters. For these bolts, the Table 403 must be used. Table 402 - TORQUE VALUES Bolts Position - Diame- Final Tightening Torque Tightening Torque (lbf x in) ter ( in) (lbf x in) [2] A26 - 9/16 1600 1600 [2] A34 - 9/16 1400 1400 [1] [1] A40 - 5/8 1850 1900 [2] A28 - 9/16 1600 1600 [2] A38 - 9/16 1400 1400 [2] A30 - 9/16 1400 1400 [2] A36 - 9/16 1400 1400 [2] A32 - 9/16 1400 1400 [1] [1] A44 - 5/8 2000 2050 [2] A25 - 1/2 1100 1100 [1] For these bolts, add the drag torque previously measured to the tightening torque. [2] For these bolts, add the drag torque previously measured to the tightening torque (must be consider 50 lbf x in as minimum value of drag torque). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 57-10-01 Page 8 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL Table 403 - TORQUE VALUES - ADAPTERS ARE USED (Continued) Bolts Position - Di- Tightening Torque Final Tightening Adapters ameter ( in) (lbf x in) Torque (lbf x in) GSE 383 or com- [2] A29 - 9/16 mercially available 1387 1387 tool accordantly GSE 383 or com- [2] A31 - 9/16 mercially available 1214 1214 tool accordantly GSE 383 or com- [2] A33 - 9/16 mercially available 1214 1214 tool accordantly GSE 383 or com- [2] A35 - 9/16 mercially available 1214 1214 tool accordantly GSE 383 or com- [2] A37 - 9/16 mercially available 1214 1214 tool accordantly GSE 383 or com- [2] A39 - 9/16 mercially available 1214 1214 tool accordantly GSE 383 or com- [1] [1] A41 - 5/8 mercially available 1604 1654 tool accordantly [1] [1] A42 - 3/4 GSE 148 1939 1989 [1] [1] A43 - 3/4 GSE 148 1939 1989 [1] For these bolts, add the drag torque previously measured to the tightening torque. [2] For these bolts, add the drag torque previously measured to the tightening torque (must be consider 50 lbf x in as minimum value of drag torque). (4) Apply yellow torque paint to the nut after the final tightening torque is applied. (5) After the sealant application and cure, sealant in contact with fuel must be painted with antibiological compound coating (TASK 28–11–00–300–801–A). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install access panels 531AB/631AB, and 531EZ/631EZ ( AMM MPP 06-44-00/100). (2) Install access panels 155BZ/156BZ, and 155NZ/156NZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (3) Install the center wing-to-fuselage fairing ( AMM TASK 53-04-10-400-801-A/400). (4) Install the forward wing-to-fuselage fairing ( AMM TASK 53-04-01-400-801-A/400). (5) Refuel the tanks ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300). (6) Remove the grounding cable from the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-02-910-801-A/200). (7) Restore the aircraft to normal condition. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 57-10-01 Page 11 of 11 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
